trans-unit.source: How to Use Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: How to Use Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Learn how to improve the performance of your Azure applications with Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Learn how to improve the performance of your Azure applications with Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: How to Use Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: How to Use Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to get started using
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to get started using

trans-unit.source: **Azure Redis Cache**.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Redis Cache**.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in C\# code and
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in C\# code and

trans-unit.source: use the [StackExchange.Redis][] client.
trans-unit.target: use the [StackExchange.Redis][] client.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include **creating and configuring a cache**, **configuring cache clients**, **adding and removing objects from the cache**, and **storing ASP.NET session state in the cache**.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include **creating and configuring a cache**, **configuring cache clients**, **adding and removing objects from the cache**, and **storing ASP.NET session state in the cache**.

trans-unit.source: For more
trans-unit.target: For more

trans-unit.source: information on using Azure Redis Cache, refer to the [Next Steps][] section.
trans-unit.target: information on using Azure Redis Cache, refer to the [Next Steps][] section.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure Redis Cache?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Redis Cache?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache is based on the popular open source Redis Cache.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache is based on the popular open source Redis Cache.

trans-unit.source: It gives you access to a secure, dedicated Redis cache, managed by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: It gives you access to a secure, dedicated Redis cache, managed by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: A cache created using Azure Redis Cache is accessible from any application within Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: A cache created using Azure Redis Cache is accessible from any application within Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache is available in two tiers:
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache is available in two tiers:

trans-unit.source: **Basic** – Single node.
trans-unit.target: **Basic** – Single node.

trans-unit.source: Multiple sizes up to 53 GB.
trans-unit.target: Multiple sizes up to 53 GB.

trans-unit.source: **Standard** – Two-node Primary/Replica.
trans-unit.target: **Standard** – Two-node Primary/Replica.

trans-unit.source: Multiple sizes up to 53 GB.
trans-unit.target: Multiple sizes up to 53 GB.

trans-unit.source: Each tier differs in terms of features and pricing.
trans-unit.target: Each tier differs in terms of features and pricing.

trans-unit.source: The features are covered later in this guide, and for more information on pricing, see [Cache Pricing Details][].
trans-unit.target: The features are covered later in this guide, and for more information on pricing, see [Cache Pricing Details][].

trans-unit.source: This guide provides an overview of getting started with Azure Redis Cache.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides an overview of getting started with Azure Redis Cache.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information on these features that are beyond the scope of this getting started guide, see [Overview of Azure Redis Cache][].
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information on these features that are beyond the scope of this getting started guide, see [Overview of Azure Redis Cache][].

trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Getting started with Azure Redis Cache is easy.
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Azure Redis Cache is easy.

trans-unit.source: To get started, you provision and configure a cache.
trans-unit.target: To get started, you provision and configure a cache.

trans-unit.source: Next, you configure the cache clients so they can access the cache.
trans-unit.target: Next, you configure the cache clients so they can access the cache.

trans-unit.source: Once the cache clients are configured, you can begin working with them.
trans-unit.target: Once the cache clients are configured, you can begin working with them.

trans-unit.source: [Create the cache][]
trans-unit.target: [Create the cache][]

trans-unit.source: [Configure the cache clients][]
trans-unit.target: [Configure the cache clients][]

trans-unit.source: Create a cache
trans-unit.target: Create a cache

trans-unit.source: To create a cache, first sign in to the [Azure preview portal][], and click **New**, **Data + Storage**, **Redis Cache**.
trans-unit.target: To create a cache, first sign in to the [Azure preview portal][], and click **New**, **Data + Storage**, **Redis Cache**.

trans-unit.source: New cache
trans-unit.target: New cache

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you don't have an Azure account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you don't have an Azure account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial][].
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial][].

trans-unit.source: In the **New Redis Cache** blade, specify the desired configuration for the cache.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Redis Cache** blade, specify the desired configuration for the cache.

trans-unit.source: Create cache
trans-unit.target: Create cache

trans-unit.source: In **Dns name**, enter a subdomain name to use for the cache endpoint.
trans-unit.target: In **Dns name**, enter a subdomain name to use for the cache endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint must be a string between six and twenty characters, contain only lowercase numbers and letters, and must start with a letter.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint must be a string between six and twenty characters, contain only lowercase numbers and letters, and must start with a letter.

trans-unit.source: Use **Pricing Tier** to select the desired cache size and features.
trans-unit.target: Use **Pricing Tier** to select the desired cache size and features.

trans-unit.source: **Basic** caches have a single node with multiple sizes up to 53 GB.
trans-unit.target: **Basic** caches have a single node with multiple sizes up to 53 GB.

trans-unit.source: **Standard** caches have a two node primary/replica configuration with a 99.9% SLA, and multiple sizes up to 53 GB.
trans-unit.target: **Standard** caches have a two node primary/replica configuration with a 99.9% SLA, and multiple sizes up to 53 GB.

trans-unit.source: In **Resource group**, select or create a resource group for your cache.
trans-unit.target: In **Resource group**, select or create a resource group for your cache.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For more information, see [Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources][].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For more information, see [Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources][].

trans-unit.source: For **Subscription**, select the Azure subscription that you want to use for the cache.
trans-unit.target: For **Subscription**, select the Azure subscription that you want to use for the cache.

trans-unit.source: If your account has only one subscription, it will be automatically selected and the **Subscription** drop-down will not be displayed.
trans-unit.target: If your account has only one subscription, it will be automatically selected and the **Subscription** drop-down will not be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Use **Location** to specify the geographic location in which your cache is hosted.
trans-unit.target: Use **Location** to specify the geographic location in which your cache is hosted.

trans-unit.source: For the best performance, Microsoft strongly recommends that you create the cache in the same region as the cache client application.
trans-unit.target: For the best performance, Microsoft strongly recommends that you create the cache in the same region as the cache client application.

trans-unit.source: Once the new cache options are configured, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Once the new cache options are configured, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: It can take a few minutes for the cache to be created.
trans-unit.target: It can take a few minutes for the cache to be created.

trans-unit.source: To check the status, you can monitor the progress on the startboard.
trans-unit.target: To check the status, you can monitor the progress on the startboard.

trans-unit.source: After the cache has been created, your new cache has a **Running** status and is ready for use with default settings.
trans-unit.target: After the cache has been created, your new cache has a **Running** status and is ready for use with default settings.

trans-unit.source: Cache created
trans-unit.target: Cache created

trans-unit.source: Once your cache is created, you can access it from the **Browse** blade.
trans-unit.target: Once your cache is created, you can access it from the **Browse** blade.

trans-unit.source: Browse blade
trans-unit.target: Browse blade

trans-unit.source: Click **Redis Caches** to view your caches.
trans-unit.target: Click **Redis Caches** to view your caches.

trans-unit.source: Caches
trans-unit.target: Caches

trans-unit.source: Configure the cache clients
trans-unit.target: Configure the cache clients

trans-unit.source: A cache created using Azure Redis Cache is accessible from any Azure application.
trans-unit.target: A cache created using Azure Redis Cache is accessible from any Azure application.

trans-unit.source: .NET applications developed in Visual Studio can use the **StackExchange.Redis** cache client, which can be configured using a NuGet package that simplifies the configuration of cache client applications.
trans-unit.target: .NET applications developed in Visual Studio can use the **StackExchange.Redis** cache client, which can be configured using a NuGet package that simplifies the configuration of cache client applications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For more information, see the [StackExchange.Redis][] github page and the [StackExchange.Redis cache client documentation][].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For more information, see the [StackExchange.Redis][] github page and the [StackExchange.Redis cache client documentation][].

trans-unit.source: To configure a client application in Visual Studio using the StackExchange.Redis NuGet package, right-click the project in **Solution Explorer** and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: To configure a client application in Visual Studio using the StackExchange.Redis NuGet package, right-click the project in **Solution Explorer** and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Manage NuGet packages
trans-unit.target: Manage NuGet packages

trans-unit.source: Type **StackExchange.Redis** or **StackExchange.Redis.StrongName** into the **Search Online** text box, select the desired version from the results, and click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Type **StackExchange.Redis** or **StackExchange.Redis.StrongName** into the **Search Online** text box, select the desired version from the results, and click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you prefer to use a strong-named version of the **StackExchange.Redis** client library, choose **StackExchange.Redis.StrongName**; otherwise choose **StackExchange.Redis**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you prefer to use a strong-named version of the **StackExchange.Redis** client library, choose **StackExchange.Redis.StrongName**; otherwise choose **StackExchange.Redis**.

trans-unit.source: StackExchange.Redis NuGet package
trans-unit.target: StackExchange.Redis NuGet package

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package downloads and adds the required assembly references for your client application to access Azure Redis Cache with the StackExchange.Redis cache client.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package downloads and adds the required assembly references for your client application to access Azure Redis Cache with the StackExchange.Redis cache client.

trans-unit.source: Once your client project is configured for caching, you can use the techniques described in the following sections for working with your cache.
trans-unit.target: Once your client project is configured for caching, you can use the techniques described in the following sections for working with your cache.

trans-unit.source: Working with Caches
trans-unit.target: Working with Caches

trans-unit.source: The steps in this section describe how to perform common tasks with Cache.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this section describe how to perform common tasks with Cache.

trans-unit.source: [Connect to the cache][]
trans-unit.target: [Connect to the cache][]

trans-unit.source: [Add and retrieve objects from the cache][]
trans-unit.target: [Add and retrieve objects from the cache][]

trans-unit.source: [Store ASP.NET session state in the cache][]
trans-unit.target: [Store ASP.NET session state in the cache][]

trans-unit.source: Connect to the cache
trans-unit.target: Connect to the cache

trans-unit.source: In order to programmatically work with a cache, you need a reference to the cache.
trans-unit.target: In order to programmatically work with a cache, you need a reference to the cache.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to the top of any file from which you want to use the StackExchange.Redis client to access an Azure Redis Cache:
trans-unit.target: Add the following to the top of any file from which you want to use the StackExchange.Redis client to access an Azure Redis Cache:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The StackExchange.Redis client requires .NET Framework 4 or higher.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The StackExchange.Redis client requires .NET Framework 4 or higher.

trans-unit.source: The connection to the Azure Redis Cache is managed by the `ConnectionMultiplexer` class.
trans-unit.target: The connection to the Azure Redis Cache is managed by the `ConnectionMultiplexer` class.

trans-unit.source: This class is designed to be shared and reused throughout your client application, and does not need to be created on a per operation basis.
trans-unit.target: This class is designed to be shared and reused throughout your client application, and does not need to be created on a per operation basis.

trans-unit.source: To connect to an Azure Redis Cache and be returned an instance of a connected `ConnectionMultiplexer`, call the static `Connect` method and pass in the cache endpoint and key like the following example.
trans-unit.target: To connect to an Azure Redis Cache and be returned an instance of a connected `ConnectionMultiplexer`, call the static `Connect` method and pass in the cache endpoint and key like the following example.

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure key generated from the preview portal as the password parameter.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure key generated from the preview portal as the password parameter.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Warning: Never store credentials in source code.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Warning: Never store credentials in source code.

trans-unit.source: To keep this sample simple, I’m showing them in the source code.
trans-unit.target: To keep this sample simple, I’m showing them in the source code.

trans-unit.source: See [How Application Strings and Connection Strings Work][] for information on how to store credentials.
trans-unit.target: See [How Application Strings and Connection Strings Work][] for information on how to store credentials.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to use SSL, either set `ssl=false` or omit the `ssl` parameter.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to use SSL, either set `ssl=false` or omit the `ssl` parameter.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The non-SSL port is disabled by default for new caches.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The non-SSL port is disabled by default for new caches.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on enabling the non-SSL port, see the Access Ports section in the [Configure a cache in Azure Redis Cache][] topic.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on enabling the non-SSL port, see the Access Ports section in the [Configure a cache in Azure Redis Cache][] topic.

trans-unit.source: For more information on advanced connection configuration options, see [StackExchange.Redis configuration model][].
trans-unit.target: For more information on advanced connection configuration options, see [StackExchange.Redis configuration model][].

trans-unit.source: The cache endpoint and keys can be obtained from the **Redis Cache** blade for your cache instance.
trans-unit.target: The cache endpoint and keys can be obtained from the **Redis Cache** blade for your cache instance.

trans-unit.source: Cache properties
trans-unit.target: Cache properties

trans-unit.source: Manage keys
trans-unit.target: Manage keys

trans-unit.source: Once the connection is established, return a reference to the redis cache database by calling the `ConnectionMultiplexer.GetDatabase` method.
trans-unit.target: Once the connection is established, return a reference to the redis cache database by calling the `ConnectionMultiplexer.GetDatabase` method.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The object returned from the `GetDatabase` method is a lightweight pass-through object and does not need to be stored.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The object returned from the `GetDatabase` method is a lightweight pass-through object and does not need to be stored.

trans-unit.source: Now that you know how to connect to an Azure Redis Cache instance and return a reference to the cache database, let's take a look at working with the cache.
trans-unit.target: Now that you know how to connect to an Azure Redis Cache instance and return a reference to the cache database, let's take a look at working with the cache.

trans-unit.source: Add and retrieve objects from the cache
trans-unit.target: Add and retrieve objects from the cache

trans-unit.source: Items can be stored in and retrieved from a cache by using the `StringSet` and `StringGet` methods.
trans-unit.target: Items can be stored in and retrieved from a cache by using the `StringSet` and `StringGet` methods.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Redis stores most data as Redis strings, but these strings can contain many types of data, including serialized binary data, which can be used when storing .NET objects in the cache.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Redis stores most data as Redis strings, but these strings can contain many types of data, including serialized binary data, which can be used when storing .NET objects in the cache.

trans-unit.source: When calling `StringGet`, if the object exists, it is returned, and if it does not, null is returned.
trans-unit.target: When calling `StringGet`, if the object exists, it is returned, and if it does not, null is returned.

trans-unit.source: In this case you can retrieve the value from the desired data source and store it in the cache for subsequent use.
trans-unit.target: In this case you can retrieve the value from the desired data source and store it in the cache for subsequent use.

trans-unit.source: This is known as the cache-aside pattern.
trans-unit.target: This is known as the cache-aside pattern.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Redis Cache can cache .NET objects as well as primitive data types, but before a .NET object can be cached it must be serialized.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Redis Cache can cache .NET objects as well as primitive data types, but before a .NET object can be cached it must be serialized.

trans-unit.source: This is the responsibility of the application developer, and gives the developer flexibility in the choice of the serializer.
trans-unit.target: This is the responsibility of the application developer, and gives the developer flexibility in the choice of the serializer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Work with .NET objects in the cache][].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Work with .NET objects in the cache][].

trans-unit.source: Specify the expiration of an item in the cache
trans-unit.target: Specify the expiration of an item in the cache

trans-unit.source: To specify the expiration of an item in the cache, use the `TimeSpan` parameter of `StringSet`.
trans-unit.target: To specify the expiration of an item in the cache, use the `TimeSpan` parameter of `StringSet`.

trans-unit.source: Store ASP.NET session state in the cache
trans-unit.target: Store ASP.NET session state in the cache

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache provides a session state provider that you can use to store your session state in a cache rather than in-memory or in a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache provides a session state provider that you can use to store your session state in a cache rather than in-memory or in a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: To use the caching session
trans-unit.target: To use the caching session

trans-unit.source: state provider, first configure your cache, and then configure your ASP.NET application for cache using the Redis Cache Session State NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: state provider, first configure your cache, and then configure your ASP.NET application for cache using the Redis Cache Session State NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: To configure a client application in Visual Studio using the Redis Cache Session State NuGet package, right-click the project in **Solution Explorer** and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: To configure a client application in Visual Studio using the Redis Cache Session State NuGet package, right-click the project in **Solution Explorer** and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Manage NuGet packages
trans-unit.target: Manage NuGet packages

trans-unit.source: Type **RedisSessionStateProvider** into the **Search Online** text box, select it from the results, and click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Type **RedisSessionStateProvider** into the **Search Online** text box, select it from the results, and click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Session State NuGet Package
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Session State NuGet Package

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package downloads and adds the required assembly references and adds the following adds the following section into your web.config file that contains the required configuration for your ASP.NET application to use the Redis Cache Session State Provider.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package downloads and adds the required assembly references and adds the following adds the following section into your web.config file that contains the required configuration for your ASP.NET application to use the Redis Cache Session State Provider.

trans-unit.source: The commented section provides an example of the attributes and sample settings for them.
trans-unit.target: The commented section provides an example of the attributes and sample settings for them.

trans-unit.source: Configure the attributes with the values from your cache blade on the preview portal, and configure the other values as desired.
trans-unit.target: Configure the attributes with the values from your cache blade on the preview portal, and configure the other values as desired.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to comment out the standard **InProc** session state provider.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to comment out the standard **InProc** session state provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring these settings and using the Azure Redis Session State Provider, see [Azure Redis Session State Provider][].
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring these settings and using the Azure Redis Session State Provider, see [Azure Redis Session State Provider][].

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you've learned the basics of Azure Redis Cache,
trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned the basics of Azure Redis Cache,

trans-unit.source: follow these links to learn how to do more complex caching tasks.
trans-unit.target: follow these links to learn how to do more complex caching tasks.

trans-unit.source: [Enable cache diagnostics](cache-how-to-monitor.md#enable-cache-diagnostics) so you can [cache-how-to-monitor.md) the health of your cache.
trans-unit.target: [Enable cache diagnostics](cache-how-to-monitor.md#enable-cache-diagnostics) so you can [cache-how-to-monitor.md) the health of your cache.

trans-unit.source: You can view the metrics in the preview portal and you can also [download and review](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/tree/master/CustomMonitoring) them using the tools of your choice.
trans-unit.target: You can view the metrics in the preview portal and you can also [download and review](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/tree/master/CustomMonitoring) them using the tools of your choice.

trans-unit.source: Check out the [StackExchange.Redis cache client documentation][].
trans-unit.target: Check out the [StackExchange.Redis cache client documentation][].

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache can be accessed from many Redis clients and development languages.
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache can be accessed from many Redis clients and development languages.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [http://redis.io/clients][] and [Develop in other languages for Azure Redis Cache][].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [http://redis.io/clients][] and [Develop in other languages for Azure Redis Cache][].

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache can also be used with services such as Redsmin.
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache can also be used with services such as Redsmin.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to retrieve an Azure Redis connection string and use it with Redsmin][].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to retrieve an Azure Redis connection string and use it with Redsmin][].

trans-unit.source: See the [redis][] documentation and read about [redis data types][] and [a fifteen minute introduction to Redis data types][].
trans-unit.target: See the [redis][] documentation and read about [redis data types][] and [a fifteen minute introduction to Redis data types][].

trans-unit.source: See the MSDN Reference for [Azure Redis Cache][].
trans-unit.target: See the MSDN Reference for [Azure Redis Cache][].
